r.s: PHP5 Resolver library used to communicate with a DNS server.
r.d:
Provides (roughly) the same functionality as Net_DNS, but using PHP5 objects, exceptions for error handling, better sockets support.
This release is (in most cases) 2x - 10x faster than Net_DNS, as well as includes more RR's (including DNSSEC RR's), and improved sockets and streams support.
r.n: - added support for IPv6 DNS servers; from resolv.conf files, and from name server arrays - added new IPv4 and IPv6 validation functions, and a IPv6 expand function - changed the A, AAAA and IPSECKEY RR's to use the new validation methods - added support for IPv6 PTR records - dropped the old IPv4 regex from the lookups class
